Description: Three non-joining sherds of floor, wall and rim of large pottery plate; flat rim and base; cream slip on outside and underside at least; three sets of grooves on wall; two at periphery of underside, with seven or eight more simple grooves towards centre; unpainted.
Curator's comments: Place of production uncertain. The clay analysis of the piece by Hans Mommsen, Bonn (see Schlotzhauer and Villing 2006, 55, sample Nauk 74) showed it to belong to a chemical group of unknown provenance, but the group has recently been associated with Cilicia.
Seemingly from same piece as Boston MFA 88.976. There are random scratches on the floor of 1888,0601.608b and c, probably not an intentional inscription but from use.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.55 Table 1, p. 60 fig. 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.665)
